operations.CreateConnector: Creates a connector using the specified properties.
operations.CreateCustomPlugin: Creates a custom plugin using the specified properties.
operations.CreateWorkerConfiguration: Creates a worker configuration using the specified properties.
operations.DescribeCustomPlugin: A summary description of the custom plugin.
operations.ListConnectors: Returns a list of all the connectors in this account and Region. The list is limited to connectors whose name starts with the specified prefix. The response also includes a description of each of the listed connectors.
operations.ListCustomPlugins: Returns a list of all of the custom plugins in this account and Region.
operations.ListWorkerConfigurations: Returns a list of all of the worker configurations in this account and Region.

ApacheKafkaCluster.base: The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.

refs.KafkaCluster$apacheKafkaCluster: The Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.

ApacheKafkaClusterDescription.base: The description of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.

refs.KafkaClusterDescription$apacheKafkaClust: The Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.

refs.Capacity$autoScaling: Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.

AutoScalingDescription.base: Information about the auto scaling parameters for the connector.

AutoScalingUpdate.base: The updates to the auto scaling parameters for the connector.

BadRequestException.base: HTTP Status Code 400: Bad request due to incorrect input. Correct your request and then retry it.

Capacity.base: Information about the capacity of the connector, whether it is auto scaled or provisioned.

refs.CreateConnectorRequest$capacity: Information about the capacity allocated to the connector. Exactly one of the two properties must be specified.

refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$capacity: Information about the capacity of the connector, whether it is auto scaled or provisioned.

CapacityUpdate.base: The target capacity for the connector. The capacity can be auto scaled or provisioned.

CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery.base: The settings for delivering connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

refs.WorkerLogDelivery$cloudWatchLogs: Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription.base: A description of the log delivery settings.

refs.WorkerLogDeliveryDescription$cloudWatchL: Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

ConflictException.base: HTTP Status Code 409: Conflict. A resource with this name already exists. Retry your request with another name.

refs.DeleteConnectorResponse$connectorState: The state of the connector that you requested to delete.

CustomPlugin.base: A plugin is an AWS resource that contains the code that defines a connector's logic.

CustomPluginLocation.base: Information about the location of a custom plugin.

refs.CreateCustomPluginRequest$location: Information about the location of a custom plugin.

CustomPluginLocationDescription.base: Information about the location of a custom plugin.

refs.CustomPluginRevisionSummary$location: Information about the location of the custom plugin.

CustomPluginRevisionSummary.base: Details about the revision of a custom plugin.

refs.CustomPluginSummary$latestRevision: The latest revision of the custom plugin.
refs.DescribeCustomPluginResponse$latestRevis: The latest successfully created revision of the custom plugin. If there are no successfully created revisions, this field will be absent.

FirehoseLogDelivery.base: The settings for delivering logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.

refs.WorkerLogDelivery$firehose: Details about delivering logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.

FirehoseLogDeliveryDescription.base: A description of the settings for delivering logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.

refs.WorkerLogDeliveryDescription$firehose: Details about delivering logs to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.

ForbiddenException.base: HTTP Status Code 403: Access forbidden. Correct your credentials and then retry your request.

InternalServerErrorException.base: HTTP Status Code 500: Unexpected internal server error. Retrying your request might resolve the issue.

KafkaCluster.base: The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.

refs.CreateConnectorRequest$kafkaCluster: Specifies which Apache Kafka cluster to connect to.

KafkaClusterClientAuthentication.base: The client authentication information used in order to authenticate with the Apache Kafka cluster.

refs.CreateConnectorRequest$kafkaClusterClien: Details of the client authentication used by the Apache Kafka cluster.

KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescript.base: The client authentication information used in order to authenticate with the Apache Kafka cluster.

refs.ConnectorSummary$kafkaClusterClientAuthe: The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.
refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$kafkaClusterCl: The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. The value is NONE when no client authentication is used.

refs.KafkaClusterClientAuthentication$authent: The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. Value NONE means that no client authentication is used.
refs.KafkaClusterClientAuthenticationDescript: The type of client authentication used to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster. Value NONE means that no client authentication is used.

KafkaClusterDescription.base: Details of how to connect to the Apache Kafka cluster.

refs.ConnectorSummary$kafkaCluster: The details of the Apache Kafka cluster to which the connector is connected.
refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$kafkaCluster: The Apache Kafka cluster that the connector is connected to.

KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit.base: Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.

refs.CreateConnectorRequest$kafkaClusterEncry: Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.

KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescripti.base: The description of the encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.

refs.ConnectorSummary$kafkaClusterEncryptionI: Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$kafkaClusterEn: Details of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.

refs.KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransit$encrypti: The type of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.
refs.KafkaClusterEncryptionInTransitDescripti: The type of encryption in transit to the Apache Kafka cluster.

LogDeliveryDescription.base: The description of the log delivery settings.

refs.ConnectorSummary$logDelivery: The settings for delivering connector logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$logDelivery: Details about delivering logs to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

refs.ListConnectorsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of connectors to list in one response.
refs.ListCustomPluginsRequest$maxResults: The maximum number of custom plugins to list in one response.
refs.ListWorkerConfigurationsRequest$maxResul: The maximum number of worker configurations to list in one response.

NotFoundException.base: HTTP Status Code 404: Resource not found due to incorrect input. Correct your request and then retry it.

Plugin.base: A plugin is an AWS resource that contains the code that defines your connector logic.

refs.Capacity$provisionedCapacity: Details about a fixed capacity allocated to a connector.

ProvisionedCapacityDescription.base: The description of a connector's provisioned capacity.

ProvisionedCapacityUpdate.base: An update to a connector's fixed capacity.

S3Location.base: The location of an object in Amazon S3.

refs.CustomPluginLocation$s3Location: The S3 bucket Amazon Resource Name (ARN), file key, and object version of the plugin file stored in Amazon S3.

S3LocationDescription.base: The description of the location of an object in Amazon S3.

refs.CustomPluginLocationDescription$s3Locati: The S3 bucket Amazon Resource Name (ARN), file key, and object version of the plugin file stored in Amazon S3.

S3LogDelivery.base: Details about delivering logs to Amazon S3.

ScaleInPolicyDescription.base: The description of the scale-in policy for the connector.

ScaleInPolicyUpdate.base: An update to the connector's scale-in policy.

refs.AutoScalingUpdate$scaleInPolicy: The target sacle-in policy for the connector.

ScaleOutPolicyDescription.base: The description of the scale-out policy for the connector.

ScaleOutPolicyUpdate.base: An update to the connector's scale-out policy.

refs.AutoScalingUpdate$scaleOutPolicy: The target sacle-out policy for the connector.

ServiceUnavailableException.base: HTTP Status Code 503: Service Unavailable. Retrying your request in some time might resolve the issue.

TooManyRequestsException.base: HTTP Status Code 429: Limit exceeded. Resource limit reached.

UnauthorizedException.base: HTTP Status Code 401: Unauthorized request. The provided credentials couldn't be validated.

Vpc.base: Information about the VPC in which the connector resides.

refs.ApacheKafkaCluster$vpc: Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache Kafka cluster.

VpcDescription.base: The description of the VPC in which the connector resides.

refs.ApacheKafkaClusterDescription$vpc: Details of an Amazon VPC which has network connectivity to the Apache Kafka cluster.

WorkerConfiguration.base: The configuration of the workers, which are the processes that run the connector logic.

refs.CreateConnectorRequest$workerConfigurati: Specifies which worker configuration to use with the connector.

refs.ConnectorSummary$workerConfiguration: The worker configurations that are in use with the connector.
refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$workerConfigur: Specifies which worker configuration was used for the connector.

WorkerConfigurationRevisionDescription.base: The description of the worker configuration revision.

refs.DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse$late: The latest revision of the custom configuration.

WorkerConfigurationRevisionSummary.base: The summary of a worker configuration revision.

refs.CreateWorkerConfigurationResponse$latest: The latest revision of the worker configuration.
refs.WorkerConfigurationSummary$latestRevisio: The latest revision of a worker configuration.

WorkerLogDelivery.base: Workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This configuration specifies the details of these destinations.

refs.LogDelivery$workerLogDelivery: The workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This configuration specifies the details of these destinations.

WorkerLogDeliveryDescription.base: Workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This configuration specifies the details of these destinations.

refs.LogDeliveryDescription$workerLogDelivery: The workers can send worker logs to different destination types. This configuration specifies the details of these destinations.

refs.CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery$enabled: Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.
refs.CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription$ena: Whether log delivery to Amazon CloudWatch Logs is enabled.
refs.FirehoseLogDelivery$enabled: Specifies whether connector logs get delivered to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
refs.FirehoseLogDeliveryDescription$enabled: Specifies whether connector logs get delivered to Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose.
refs.S3LogDelivery$enabled: Specifies whether connector logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3 destination.
refs.S3LogDeliveryDescription$enabled: Specifies whether connector logs get sent to the specified Amazon S3 destination.

refs.AutoScalingDescription$maxWorkerCount: The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
refs.AutoScalingDescription$mcuCount: The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
refs.AutoScalingDescription$minWorkerCount: The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
refs.ProvisionedCapacityDescription$mcuCount: The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
refs.ProvisionedCapacityDescription$workerCou: The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.
refs.ScaleInPolicyDescription$cpuUtilizationP: Specifies the CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale in to be triggered.
refs.ScaleOutPolicyDescription$cpuUtilization: The CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale out to be triggered.

refs.AutoScaling$maxWorkerCount: The maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
refs.AutoScaling$minWorkerCount: The minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
refs.AutoScalingUpdate$maxWorkerCount: The target maximum number of workers allocated to the connector.
refs.AutoScalingUpdate$minWorkerCount: The target minimum number of workers allocated to the connector.
refs.ProvisionedCapacity$workerCount: The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.
refs.ProvisionedCapacityUpdate$workerCount: The number of workers that are allocated to the connector.

refs.ScaleInPolicy$cpuUtilizationPercentage: Specifies the CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale in to be triggered.
refs.ScaleInPolicyUpdate$cpuUtilizationPercen: The target CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale in to be triggered.
refs.ScaleOutPolicy$cpuUtilizationPercentage: The CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale out to be triggered.
refs.ScaleOutPolicyUpdate$cpuUtilizationPerce: The target CPU utilization percentage threshold at which you want connector scale out to be triggered.

refs.AutoScaling$mcuCount: The number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.
refs.AutoScalingUpdate$mcuCount: The target number of microcontroller units (MCUs) allocated to each connector worker. The valid values are 1,2,4,8.

refs.CreateConnectorRequest$plugins: Specifies which plugins to use for the connector.

refs.ConnectorSummary$plugins: Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.
refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$plugins: Specifies which plugins were used for this connector.

refs.CustomPluginFileDescription$fileSize: The size in bytes of the custom plugin file. You can use it to validate the file.
refs.WorkerConfigurationRevisionDescription$r: The description of a revision of the worker configuration.

refs.CreateConnectorRequest$connectorConfigur: A map of keys to values that represent the configuration for the connector.
refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$connectorConfi: A map of keys to values that represent the configuration for the connector.

refs.CloudWatchLogsLogDelivery$logGroup: The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log delivery.
refs.CloudWatchLogsLogDeliveryDescription$log: The name of the CloudWatch log group that is the destination for log delivery.
refs.ConnectorSummary$connectorArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector.
refs.ConnectorSummary$kafkaConnectVersion: The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
refs.ConnectorSummary$serviceExecutionRoleArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access Amazon Web Services resources.
refs.CreateConnectorRequest$kafkaConnectVersi: The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
refs.CreateConnectorRequest$serviceExecutionR: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access the Amazon Web Services resources that it needs. The types of resources depends on the logic of the connector. For example, a connector that has Amazon S3 as a destination must have permissions that allow it to write to the S3 destination bucket.
refs.CreateConnectorResponse$connectorArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that Amazon assigned to the connector.
refs.CreateCustomPluginResponse$customPluginA: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that Amazon assigned to the custom plugin.
refs.CreateWorkerConfigurationResponse$worker: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that Amazon assigned to the worker configuration.
refs.CustomPlugin$customPluginArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
refs.CustomPluginDescription$customPluginArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
refs.CustomPluginFileDescription$fileMd5: The hex-encoded MD5 checksum of the custom plugin file. You can use it to validate the file.
refs.CustomPluginSummary$customPluginArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
refs.DeleteConnectorRequest$connectorArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector that you want to delete.
refs.DeleteConnectorRequest$currentVersion: The current version of the connector that you want to delete.
refs.DeleteConnectorResponse$connectorArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector that you requested to delete.
refs.DescribeConnectorRequest$connectorArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector that you want to describe.
refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$connectorArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the connector.
refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$kafkaConnectVe: The version of Kafka Connect. It has to be compatible with both the Apache Kafka cluster's version and the plugins.
refs.DescribeConnectorResponse$serviceExecuti: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role used by the connector to access Amazon Web Services resources.
refs.DescribeCustomPluginResponse$customPlugi: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom plugin.
refs.DescribeWorkerConfigurationRequest$worke: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the worker configuration that you want to get information about.
refs.DescribeWorkerConfigurationResponse$work: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the custom configuration.
refs.FirehoseLogDelivery$deliveryStream: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is the destination for log delivery.
refs.FirehoseLogDeliveryDescription$deliveryS: The name of the Kinesis Data Firehose delivery stream that is the destination for log delivery.
refs.ListConnectorsRequest$connectorNamePrefi: The name prefix that you want to use to search for and list connectors.
refs.ListConnectorsRequest$nextToken: If the response of a ListConnectors operation is truncated, it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to continue listing from where the previous operation left off.
refs.ListConnectorsResponse$nextToken: If the response of a ListConnectors operation is truncated, it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to continue listing from where it left off.
refs.ListCustomPluginsRequest$nextToken: If the response of a ListCustomPlugins operation is truncated, it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to continue listing from where the previous operation left off.
refs.ListCustomPluginsResponse$nextToken: If the response of a ListCustomPlugins operation is truncated, it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to continue listing from where the previous operation left off.
refs.ListWorkerConfigurationsRequest$nextToke: If the response of a ListWorkerConfigurations operation is truncated, it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to continue listing from where the previous operation left off.
refs.ListWorkerConfigurationsResponse$nextTok: If the response of a ListWorkerConfigurations operation is truncated, it will include a NextToken. Send this NextToken in a subsequent request to continue listing from where the previous operation left off.
